Field Detail

mGridObj

private Grid mGridObj
Created in the 'GridChecker' constructor.

mData

private byte[] mData
Each index corresponds with a sudoku entry in the grid.

mSize

private int mSize
The number of columns, rows, and subgrids in the grid.

mSubgridSize

private int mSubgridSize
The number of columns/rows in a subgrid.

mInvalidIndex

private Vector<Integer> mInvalidIndex
Contains array indices of where there are invalid entries in the Sudoku puzzle. Negative values signify indices where a non-visible number is conflicting with a visible guess. If there are no invalid sudoku entries then the vector is empty.

mInvalidIndexPrelim

private Vector<Integer> mInvalidIndexPrelim
Used to save values from an invalid row, column, or subgrid just in case there is more than one conflict per section.

mIsGridValid

private boolean mIsGridValid
'true' if 'mData' contains a valid sudoku solution, 'false' otherwise.

GridChecker

public GridChecker(byte[] inData)
Constructs a new GridChecker instance.

Parameters:
inData - the grid object data. Sets all data members to their default value. The parameter is used as a parameter for the 'Grid' constructor.

checkSection

public void checkSection(byte[] inData)
Insures the parameter contains no duplicate entries.

Parameters:
inData - the grid object data.

public Grid getGridObj()
Returns:
the grid object.

Returns:
the size of the grid.

the size of a subgrid.

getIsGridValid

public boolean getIsGridValid()
Returns:
'true' if the grid is valid, 'false'otherwise.

checkGrid

public boolean checkGrid()
Checks all rows, columns, and subgrids of the grid object until an invalid entry is encountered.

Returns:
determines if grid contains a valid sudoku entry ('true')

formatIndexes

public void formatIndexes()
Makes the indexes negative or positive, relative to whether the box at the specified index should be marked incorrect or not. Negative values will not be marked as incorrect because the player can't see the conflicting value.

getInvalidIndexes

public Vector<Integer> getInvalidIndexes()
Get Invalid Indexes

Returns:
An integer vector with all of the indexes where there exists a conflict in the grid.

setInvalidIndex

public void setInvalidIndex(Vector<Integer> inVector)
Set Invalid Index

Parameters:
inVector - Can change the invalid index vector to this paramater vector.

setIsGridValid

public void setIsGridValid(boolean setToThis)
Sets a data member equal to parameter.

Parameters:
setToThis - 'true' if the grid contains a valid solution.

preliminaryGridCheck

public void preliminaryGridCheck()
Insures that the grid is considered valid only if all its grid entries are within a valid range. The valid range is -'mSize' to +'mSize' (excluding 0).

checkAllRows

public void checkAllRows()
Check all rows of the grid to find a possible invalid sudoku entry.

checkAllColumns

public void checkAllColumns()
Check all columns of grid to find a possible invalid sudoku entry.

checkAllSubgrids

public void checkAllSubgrids()
Check all subgrids of grid to find a possible invalid sudoku entry.
